intro: Arthrostemma cataphractum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf arthrostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, violet to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
